intro: Ebenus leucomelas, commonly known as the white-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent habit and small, white or pale flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically fleshy and gray-green, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Ebenus leucomelas thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dunes.
